public class InputValidationController extends Object
programm to validate user input in working time management tool

  • Constructor Details

    • InputValidationController

      public InputValidationController​(ArrayList<models.Timespann> input, Duration legalBreak, Duration totalWorkingTime, Duration timeAtBreak, LocalTime workBegin, LocalTime workEnd, LocalDate selectedDay, LocalTime workEndYesterday)
      Class constructor creating input validation controller
      Parameters:
      input - a list of working times, break times, work interruptions and break interruptions in Timespann
      legalBreak - legally required minimum break duration based on working time in hh:mm:ss
      totalWorkingTime - total working duration at a working day in hh:mm:ss
      timeAtBreak - total break duration in hh:mm:ss
      workBegin - begin of working time at working day in hh:mm
      workEnd - end of working time at working day in hh:mm
      selectedDay - date of considered working day for which the working day information should be calculated and recorded in yyyy-mm-dd
      workEndYesterday - end of working time the day before the selected working day in yyyy-mm-dd

  • Method Details

    • validation

      public ArrayList<models.ValidationState> validation()
      executes validation steps
      Returns:
      a list of ValidationStates with VALID (means pass) or NOT_VALID+Failing outcome (means fail)
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - when no date is selected

    • checkDurationBetweenWorkingDays

      private models.ValidationState checkDurationBetweenWorkingDays​(LocalDateTime workEndYesterday, LocalDateTime workBeginToday)
      validates, if duration between work begin of the selected working day and the work end of the previous day fulfill the legal requirements of rest period 2021, in Germany: 11 hours
      Parameters:
      workEndYesterday - end of working time the day before the selected working day in yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss which are provided by a database
      workBeginToday - begin of working time at the selected working day in yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss
      Returns:
      validation result as ValidationState of pass (VALID) or fail (NOT_VALID_DURATION_BETWEEN_WORKING_DAYS_ERROR)
      See Also:
      ValidationState

    • checkTotalWorkingTimeOverTenHours

      private models.ValidationState checkTotalWorkingTimeOverTenHours​(Duration totalWorkingTime)
      validates, if total working duration fulfills the maxmimum amount of legally allowed working hours at one working day 2021, Germany: 10 hours
      Parameters:
      totalWorkingTime - total working duration at a working day in hh:mm:ss
      Returns:
      validation result as ValidationState of pass (VALID) or fail (NOT_VALID_WORKING_TIME_OVER_TEN_HOURS)
      See Also:
      ValidationState

    • checkWorkTimeLimits

      private models.ValidationState checkWorkTimeLimits​(LocalTime workBegin, LocalTime workEnd)
      validates, if work begin and/or work end exceeds operational working time frame (defined by company) 2021, AfS Berlin-Brandenburg: 6:30 - 19:30
      Parameters:
      workBegin - begin of working time at working day in hh:mm
      workEnd - end of working time at working day in hh:mm
      Returns:
      validation result as ValidationState of pass (VALID) or fail (VALID_WORKBEGIN_IS_BEFORE_6_00 or VALID_WORKEND_IS_AFTER_19_30)
      See Also:
      ValidationState

    • checkDatepickerCompliance

      private models.ValidationState checkDatepickerCompliance​(LocalDate selectedDay)
      validates, if selected working day exceeds operating limits (defined by company) 2021, AfS Berlin-Brandenburg: not allows are dates in the future or dates earlier than 31 days in the past of the actual calendar date
      Parameters:
      selectedDay - date of considered working day for which the working day information should be calculated and recorded in yyyy-mm-dd
      Returns:
      validation result as ValidationState of pass (VALID) or fail (NOT_VALID_SELECTED_DAY_IS_IN_THE_FUTURE or NOT_VALID_SELECTED_DAY_IS_TO_FAR_IN_THE_PAST)
      See Also:
      ValidationState

    • checkSingleBreakDurationCompliance

      private models.ValidationState checkSingleBreakDurationCompliance​(ArrayList<models.Timespann> formattedInput, Duration legalBreak)
      validates, if single break durations fulfill a legally required single break duration. For understanding: total break duration is the sum of all single break durations which can be under, equal or higher of the legal requirements. To count as legally valid single break duration, break duration must have or exceed the given threshold. 2021, Germany: 15 minutes
      Parameters:
      formattedInput - a list of working times, break times, work interruptions and break interruptions in Timespann
      legalBreak - legally required minimum break duration based on working time in hh:mm:ss
      Returns:
      validation result as ValidationState of pass (VALID) or fail (NOT_VALID_SINGLE_BREAK_DURATIONS_ERROR)
      See Also:
      ValidationState

    • checkBreaksInWorkTime

      private models.ValidationState checkBreaksInWorkTime​(ArrayList<models.Timespann> formattedInput, LocalTime workBegin, LocalTime workEnd)
      validates, if single breaks are within working durations. Ensures that the break's begin or end time doesn't match the exact work begin or work end of the working day.
      Parameters:
      formattedInput - a list of working times, break times, work interruptions and break interruptions in Timespann
      workBegin - begin of working time at working day in hh:mm
      workEnd - end of working time at working day in hh:mm
      Returns:
      validation result as ValidationState of pass (VALID) or fail (NOT_VALID_BREAK_IS_NOT_IN_WORKTIME or NOT_VALID_BREAK_CANNOT_BE_AT_WORKING_BEGIN_OR_END)
      See Also:
      ValidationState

    • checkTimeOrderIsChronological

      private models.ValidationState checkTimeOrderIsChronological​(ArrayList<models.Timespann> formattedInput)
      validates, if the work and break input (by the user) is chronological (from earlier to later) and if the start time is always given before the end time (meaning also from earlier to later).
      Parameters:
      formattedInput - a list of working times, break times, work interruptions and break interruptions in Timespann
      Returns:
      validation result as ValidationState of pass (VALID) or fail (NOT_VALID_START_IS_AFTER_END or NOT_VALID_TIME_INPUT_MUST_BE_IN_CHRONICAL_ORDER)
      See Also:
      ValidationState

    • checkInputExists

      private models.ValidationState checkInputExists​(ArrayList<models.Timespann> formattedInput)
      validates, if at least one full work input is given (meaning start and end time)
      Parameters:
      formattedInput - a list of working times, break times, work interruptions and break interruptions in Timespann
      Returns:
      validation result as ValidationState of pass (VALID) or fail (NOT_VALID_NO_INPUT_FOUND)
      See Also:
      ValidationState

    • checkTotalBreakCompliance

      private models.ValidationState checkTotalBreakCompliance​(Duration timeAtBreak, Duration legalBreak)
      validates, if total break duration fulfills the legal required break duration
      Parameters:
      timeAtBreak - total break duration in hh:mm
      legalBreak - legally required minimum break duration based on working time in hh:mm
      Returns:
      validation result as ValidationState of pass (VALID) or fail (NOT_VALID_TOTAL_BREAK_ERROR)
      See Also:
      ValidationState

    • checkWorkingTimeOverSixHoursWithoutBreak

      private models.ValidationState checkWorkingTimeOverSixHoursWithoutBreak​(ArrayList<models.Timespann> formattedInput)
      validates, if there is any work period without breaks or interruptions which are longer than a legally admitted working duration without breaks or interruptions 2021, Germany: 6 hours of working time without break
      Parameters:
      formattedInput - a list of working times, break times, work interruptions and break interruptions in Timespann
      Returns:
      validation result as ValidationState of pass (VALID) or fail (NOT_VALID_WORKING_TIME_WITHOUT_BREAK_ERROR)
      See Also:
      ValidationState
